s.text: And it's also true that a studio such as Warner Bros. would never have spent $50 million on a film that didn't have a conventionally rabble-rousing outline and an upbeat finish.
The movie takes the view of a mordant social scientist who recognizes that consumerism has become the true world religion.
(Don't read this if you want to be surprised--but I do recommend you read this, because it's not a good surprise.)
An Iraqi officer trying to escape from the smoke-filled bunker with a huge pile of blue jeans isn't so different from the Americans lugging bullion in Louis Vuitton bags.
